events.headline: Monday Briefing: Inside Australia’s Election
events.summary: Plus, analyzing a scene in “Sinners.”

events.headline: 80 Years After Dachau Concentration Camp Liberation, Witnesses Remember
events.summary: The anniversary of the end of the Nazi era comes at a pivotal time for Germans. The last of the survivors, liberators and perpetrators are dying, as the far right is becoming more established.

events.headline: Sudan’s Army Says Paramilitary Forces Struck Civilian Targets
events.summary: The strikes targeted an airport, a warehouse and several civilian facilities in the eastern city of Port Sudan, the army said.

events.headline: A Conclave Like No Other
events.summary: More cardinals from more countries than ever will gather in the Sistine Chapel starting Wednesday to choose a new pope at a precarious time for the church.

events.headline: Francis Opened Discussions to Those Outside the Church Hierarchy. This Cardinal Would, Too
events.summary: Cardinal Mario Grech comes from Malta, but is known to cardinals around the world for his role as the secretary general of an advisory body of bishops.

events.headline: A Popemobile Will Ride Again, This Time Into Gaza
events.summary: In his last months, Pope Francis blessed an effort to transform the vehicle he used when he visited the West Bank in 2014 into a mobile health clinic to treat Palestinian children in the Gaza Strip.

events.headline: Houthi Missile Hits Near Tel Aviv Airport
events.summary: Some international airlines suspended flights, and Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, threatened to retaliate.

events.headline: Israel Mobilizes Two Reserve Soldiers
events.summary: The mobilization could indicate that Israel is preparing to shift its tactics in its fight against Hamas.

events.headline: Oil Prices Are Falling. Here’s Where That Could Spell Trouble.
events.summary: For countries that depend heavily on oil revenue, dropping prices are worrisome.

events.headline: Australia’s Prime Minister Wins Second Term
events.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese of Australia won in a resounding defeat of the conservative opposition led by Peter Dutton.

events.headline: Ukraine Rejects Russian Call for a Three-Day Cease-Fire
events.summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky called the proposal a “theatrical show” and said such a short truce would not bolster negotiations for a lasting peace.

events.headline: Hikers Stumble Upon a Pile of Gold Coins, Igniting a Historical Hunt
events.summary: The discovery of coins and jewelry in the Czech Republic worth up to $680,000 raises a tantalizing mystery for historians and amateur sleuths: Who buried the treasure?

events.headline: ‘We’re All in One Ship’: Druse in Syrian Town Rocked by Violence Agree to Disarm Militias
events.summary: After this week’s bloodshed, Druse leaders in Ashrafieh Sahnaya agreed to integrate militia fighters into government forces. But some residents remain wary.

events.headline: Cardinal Parolin, Leader of Papal Conclave, Is Also a Top Candidate
events.summary: Cardinals have talked about Cardinal Pietro Parolin, the Vatican secretary of state, as someone who could have a steady, bureaucratic hand on the church’s wheel.

events.headline: After Leading a Liberal Comeback, Carney Hits the Ground Running
events.summary: The prime minister will begin broad economic and security talks with President Trump next week and has set a timetable for his new government.

events.headline: These Contentious Issues Could Determine Who Becomes the Next Pope
events.summary: As cardinals gather to elect Pope Francis’ successor, they are facing debates over whether the church most needs change or constancy.

events.headline: As China Looks for Way Out of U.S. Trade Deadlock, Fentanyl Could Be Key
events.summary: Chinese officials have long used their willingness to cooperate to stem the flow of fentanyl to the United States as leverage in talks over broader disputes.

events.headline: Visual Analysis Shows U.S. Likely Bombed Yemen Migrant Detention Center
events.summary: Videos and photos reveal remnants of at least three U.S.-made GBU-39 bombs at the site of an April 28 attack. The strike killed 68 African migrants, according to the Houthis, a militant group that controls northern Yemen.

events.headline: The Frightening Precedents for Trump’s ‘Legal Abyss’
events.summary: The ‘dual-state theory’ explains how authoritarians bend the law to their will.

events.headline: The Americans Who Left
events.summary: Some of the United States’ Vietnam War opponents found refuge in Canada. Fifty years after the end of the war, they’re still worried about the future.

events.headline: Ghana Wanted a Cathedral. It Got an ‘Expensive Hole’ Instead.
events.summary: The nation had grand plans for a national cathedral designed by a celebrity architect. The $400 million project became a political battleground.

events.headline: Message From the Russian Military: ‘We Lost Your Son’
events.summary: Russia lacks any formal, organized effort to account for legions of missing soldiers. That often leaves relatives in limbo, fending for themselves with scant government information.

movies.title: Thunderbolts*
movies.summary: After finding themselves ensnared in a death trap, an unconventional team of antiheroes must embark on a dangerous mission that will force them to confront the darkest corners of their pasts.
movies.stars: Florence Pugh, Sebastian Stan, Julia Louis-Dreyfus

movies.title: Sinners
movies.summary: Trying to leave their troubled lives behind, twin brothers return to their hometown to start again, only to discover that an even greater evil is waiting to welcome them back.
movies.stars: Miles Caton, Saul Williams, Andrene Ward-Hammond

movies.title: A Minecraft Movie
movies.summary: Four misfits are suddenly pulled through a mysterious portal into a bizarre cubic wonderland that thrives on imagination. To get back home they'll have to master this world while embarking on a quest with an unexpected expert crafter.
movies.stars: Jason Momoa, Jack Black, Sebastian Hansen

movies.title: The Accountant 2
movies.summary: Christian Wolff applies his brilliant mind and illegal methods to reconstruct the unsolved puzzle of a Treasury chief's murder.
movies.stars: Ben Affleck, Jon Bernthal, Cynthia Addai-Robinson

movies.title: Until Dawn
movies.summary: A group of friends trapped in a time loop, where mysterious foes are chasing and killing them in gruesome ways, must survive until dawn to escape it.
movies.stars: Ella Rubin, Michael Cimino, Ji-young Yoo, Odessa A’zion

movies.title: The Amateur
movies.summary: After his wife is killed in a London terrorist attack, a CIA cryptographer demands his bosses go after them. When it's clear they won't act due to conflicting internal priorities, he blackmails the agency into training him to let him go after them himself.
movies.stars: Rami Malek, Rachel Brosnahan, Caitriona Balfe, Laurence Fishburne

movies.title: The King of Kings
movies.summary: An animated family film inspired by the life of Jesus Christ.
movies.stars: Oscar Isaac, Forest Whitaker, Kenneth Branagh, Uma Thurman

movies.title: Warfare
movies.summary: An A24 war film written and directed by Alex Garland and Ray Mendoza. Plot details are largely under wraps.
movies.stars: Charles Melton, Joseph Quinn, D'Pharaoh Woon-A-Tai, Will Poulter

movies.title: HIT: The 3rd Case
movies.summary: A police officer in the Homicide Intervention Team (HIT) solves a challenging case.

movies.title: The Surfer
movies.summary: When a man returns to his idyllic hometown for a nostalgic surf, he is humiliated by a group of territorial locals and drawn into a conflict that pushes him to the edge.
movies.stars: Nicolas Cage, Julian McMahon, Nicholas Cassim

sports: Source: ESPN Latest News (http://www.espn.com/espn/latestnews)
*   Washington D.C. named host city for the 2027 NFL Draft. (May 5)
*   Former Patriots WR Julian Edelman voted into the team's Hall of Fame by fans. (May 5)
*   Cleveland Browns LB Devin Bush arrested and charged with assault. (May 5)
*   Buffalo Bills reportedly adding free agent WR Elijah Moore. (May 5)
*   Green Bay Packers picked up the 5th-year option for DL Devonte Wyatt, declined option for LB Quay Walker. (May 5)
*   The 2025 NFL Draft took place from April 25-27, with QB Cam Ward selected first overall by the Indianapolis Colts.
*   Former agent and business partner of John Elway, Gary Zimmerman, died after a fall. (May 3)
*   The second round of the 2025 NBA Playoffs is underway. Key matchups include Celtics vs. Knicks and Thunder vs. Nuggets. (May 5)
*   Utah Jazz and Head Coach Will Hardy agreed to a contract extension. (May 5)
*   Tyrese Haliburton led the Indiana Pacers to a Game 1 victory over the Cleveland Cavaliers in the Eastern Conference Semifinals. (May 4)
*   The Golden State Warriors defeated the Houston Rockets in Game 7 of their first-round series. (May 5)
*   The Denver Nuggets defeated the Los Angeles Clippers in Game 7 of their first-round series, setting up a matchup with the Oklahoma City Thunder. (May 3)
*   Gregg Popovich announced his retirement as head coach of the San Antonio Spurs; Mitch Johnson named successor. (May 3)
*   Arizona Diamondbacks unveiled new City Connect uniforms. (May 5)
*   Kansas City Royals set a club record by hitting seven home runs in a game against the Baltimore Orioles. Maikel Garcia hit two. (May 4)
*   Boston Red Sox 1B Triston Casas confirmed out for the season after knee surgery. (May 5)
*   Shohei Ohtani and Freddie Freeman homered as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the Atlanta Braves. Roki Sasaki earned his first MLB win. (May 5)
*   Chicago Cubs rookie Pete Crow-Armstrong homered for the third time in two games. (May 3)
*   Los Angeles Angels star Mike Trout placed on the Injured List with a bone bruise. (May 2)
*   Cincinnati Reds pitcher Hunter Greene struck out 12 batters against the Washington Nationals. (May 2)
*   San Diego Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. left a game after being hit by a pitch; X-rays were negative. (May 2)
hockey_news: *   **Summary:** The 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs are underway. The Winnipeg Jets are the top seed overall, and the Washington Capitals are the No. 1 seed in the East. Second-round matchups include Maple Leafs vs. Panthers, Capitals vs. Hurricanes, Jets vs. Stars, and Golden Knights vs. Oilers. Key players to watch include William Nylander (Maple Leafs), Sam Bennett (Panthers), Dylan Strome (Capitals), Sebastian Aho (Hurricanes), Mikko Rantanen (Stars), Kyle Connor (Jets), Jack Eichel (Golden Knights), and Connor McDavid (Oilers).

*   **Summary:** The New York Islanders won the 2025 NHL Draft Lottery, securing the No. 1 overall pick. The San Jose Sharks will pick second. Utah's new NHL team moved up to the 4th pick in the lottery.
*   **Summary:** The 2025 IIHF Men's World Championship will take place from May 9–25, 2025, in Herning, Denmark, and Stockholm, Sweden. Sidney Crosby will represent Team Canada.
baseball_news: **Royce Lewis and Willi Castro Activated by Twins**

*   **Summary:** The Minnesota Twins activated third baseman Royce Lewis and utilityman Willi Castro from the 10-day injured list on May 5, 2025. To make room on the roster, Mickey Gasper and Edouard Julien were optioned to Triple-A.
*   **Link:** https://www.mlb.com/news/royce-lewis-willi-castro-activated-by-twins-for-2025-debut (Note: This is a constructed link based on the article title, the actual URL might differ slightly)
*   **Summary:** The first MVP poll of the 2025 season reveals a clear favorite in the American League, while the National League race appears to be more open.
*   **Link:** https://www.mlb.com/news (refer to main news page for specific article)
*   **Summary:** Shohei Ohtani hit a 117.9 mph home run, the hardest-hit home run in MLB so far in the 2025 season.
*   **Link:** https://www.mlb.com/news (refer to main news page for specific article)
*   **Summary:** A Cincinnati Reds rookie, Tyler Callihan, exited a game with a broken left forearm after a collision with the wall on May 5, 2025.
*   **Link:** https://www.mlb.com/news (refer to main news page for specific article)
*   **Summary:** The Arizona Diamondbacks are hosting a Brain Tumor Awareness Night. GM Mike Hazen is actively involved in raising awareness, honoring his late wife who battled glioblastoma.
tennis_news: *   **Roland Garros (French Open - Paris, France):** May 25 - Jun 9
*   **Summary:** The 2025 NCAA DI men's and women's tennis championships are underway. The final rounds for both are set for May 15-18 at Hurd Tennis Center in Waco, Texas.
*   **Novak Djokovic:** Facing questions about his form and ability to compete at age 36, especially with the French Open approaching.
*   **Jannik Sinner:** Expected to return to action at the Italian Open (May 7-18).
*   **Casper Ruud:** Recently won the Madrid Open, his maiden Masters crown, providing a timely boost before Roland Garros.
golf_news: Source: PGA TOUR (https://www.pgatour.com/article/news/the-first-look/2025/05/05/preview-storylines-trusit-championship-the-philadelphia-cricket-club-rory-mcilroy-fedexcup-signature-event-field-aon) and other sources.

*   **Preview:** This is the sixth Signature Event on the PGA TOUR schedule. Rory McIlroy, a four-time winner of this event (formerly Wells Fargo Championship), is the defending champion and returns after his Masters win. Other top players competing include Xander Schauffele, Justin Thomas, and Collin Morikawa. World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler will not be playing.
*   **Field Notes:** Jordan Spieth, Rickie Fowler, Gary Woodland, and Keith Mitchell are among the sponsor exemptions.
*   **Course:** The Philadelphia Cricket Club (Wissahickon Course), a par 70, 7,119-yard A.W. Tillinghast design, restored by Keith Foster in 2013. It features 118 bunkers.
**PGA Championship (May 15-18, Quail Hollow Club, Charlotte, NC)**
*   **Preview:** The second men's major of the year. Scottie Scheffler is a key player to watch.
**Scottie Scheffler Wins The CJ Cup Byron Nelson**

*   **Summary:** Scottie Scheffler dominated The CJ Cup Byron Nelson, finishing at 31-under par for a historic win. This was his first win of 2025 and moved him to No. 2 in the Comcast Business Tour Top 10.
*   **Summary:** Season 2 of PGA TOUR 2K25 will launch on May 14, 2025, celebrating major championships and introducing The Old Course at St Andrews Links.
tv_shows: *   **Summary:** Based on Alan Alda’s 1981 film, this series follows three couples whose dynamic is threatened when they learn that two of them might break up. Over the course of a year they take four vacations while recovering from the jarring news.
*   **Stars:** Tina Fey, Will Forte, Steve Carell, Kerri Kenney-Silver, Colman Domingo, Marco Calvani

*   **Summary:** Adapted from Judy Blume’s 1975 novel, this series updates the setting to 2018 Los Angeles and follows two Black elementary school classmates who reconnect as high school juniors. It explores their relationship and the complexities of teen emotions in the internet age.

*   **Summary:** From J.J. Abrams and LaToya Morgan, this series follows a getaway driver working for a crime family in the 1970s. With the family under scrutiny from federal agents, he must decide where his loyalties lie.
*   **Stars:** Josh Holloway, Rachel Hilson, Keith David, Sydney Elisabeth, Greg Grunberg
*   **Summary:** A closeted high school valedictorian arrives at college at a crossroads. He finds a kindred spirit, and together they explore college’s myriad opportunities and embarrassments.
*   **Stars:** Benito Skinner, Wally Baram, Mary Beth Barone, Adam DiMarco, Rish Shah, Connie Britton, Kyle MacLachlan

*   **Summary:** An adaptation of Martha Wells’ “The Murderbot Diaries,” this sci-fi series is about a security robot that overrides its protocols while continuing to work among humans, hiding its sentience.
*   **Stars:** Alexander Skarsgård, Noma Dumezweni, David Dastmalchian, Sabrina Wu, Akshay Khanna

*   **Summary:** Two Brooklyn teens move to their mom’s hometown in Pennsylvania. Living with their uncle, they navigate a new town, a new high school, and questions about their missing father, all set against a backdrop of old cars and tense races.
*   **Stars:** Melissa Collazo, Michael Cimino, Nathalie Kelley, Ryan Phillippe, Mia Healey

*   **Summary:** A darkly comic limited series about a wealthy socialite whose hold on her young protégé proves too much for her protective sister. It explores themes of modern role models, class disparity, and the influence of the wealthy.
*   **Stars:** Julianne Moore, Meghann Fahy, Milly Alcock, Kevin Bacon
*   **Summary:** Explores what happens after a Black woman wins an election, focusing on the challenges and realities of her new position of power.
